cntFile

Class cntFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • cntFile.cntFile

  • public class cntFile
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a .cnt to file and allows to accedd it.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      cntFile(java.lang.String path)
      Default constructor for cntFile.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int calculateArraySizeFromSecIntervall(double intervall)
      Calculate the size an array has to be to fit all the samples for a given intervall (in sec).
      void close()
      Close the cnt file after usage.
      int getNumberOfChannels()
      Returns the number of channels for this cnt file
      long getNumberOfSamples()
      Returns the number of samples for this cnt file.
      int getSamplingRate()
      Returns the sampling rate for this cnt file.
      void readRawData(double[][] data)
      Reads all data for all channels from the .cnt file.
      void readRawIntervallData(int channel, double sTimeSec, double eTimeSec, double[] data) 
      void scaleChannelData(double[] data, int channelNumber)
      Scales the raw data for on specific channel to micro volts.
      void scaleData(double[][] data)
      Scale the raw data from the file to micro volts.

      • readRawData

        public void readRawData(double[][] data)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Reads all data for all channels from the .cnt file.
        Parameters:
        data[number - of channels][number of samples]
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

      • readRawIntervallData

        public void readRawIntervallData(int channel,
                                 double sTimeSec,
                                 double eTimeSec,
                                 double[] data)
                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                 BadChannelException,
                                 BadIntervallException,
                                 java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Parameters:
        channel - channel you want to read from (counting starts at 0)
        sTimeSec - start time of the intervall in seconds
        eTimeSec - end time of the intervall in seconds
        data - target array, data will be stored in this array. make sure the array is large enough by using calculateArraySizeFromSecIntervall()
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        BadChannelException
        BadIntervallException
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
